ygData.subject: Re: Follow The Leader.
ygData.msgSnippet: Tavatron felt Dinobot tense, her arms about his neck seeming to bother him considerably. She had to remember that he was a warrior first,and no warrior liked

Tavatron felt Dinobot tense, her arms about his neck seeming to
bother him considerably. She had to remember that he was a warrior 
first,and no warrior liked feeling threatened.  That included having 
someone's hands about their neck. Tavatron eased up slightly, only to 
tighten her grip when Dinobot began to run. This was an entirely new 
experience for her. She'd never ridin a veloceraptor before, muchless 
a transmetal one. 

Before her lay the forest, and a blazing inferno(<-- fire, not the 
'bot ^_^). So much for escaping through the forest. Perhaps there was 
a way around the fire. She had no idea what there destination was,
but assumed it was the ark (<-- doesn't know about C.F.). Perhaps
they could travel around the fire, and enter the forest further down--

Tavatron's train of thought was broken when Dinobot spoke. So, he 
wasn't abandoning battle. She should have guessed as much. Dinobot 
seemed to be thoroughly enjoying the situation. This actually wasn't 
so bad. Tavatron loosened her grip on Dinobot as she began to relax. 
Tavatron was watching the trees whip by as Dinobot gained speed, not 
realizing that they were headed directly for Pyro until it was too 
late. Tavatron gasped in shock as Dinobot launched himself in the
air, instinctively tightening her grip about his neck and 
automatically digging her heels in his side. The running she could 
take, but this was too much! She had never been much of a jumper. By 
nature she wasa ground creature, and had planned to remain one for
the majority of her life. 

Tavatron burried her face in Dinobot's neck, shutting her optics 
tightly as she felt Dinobot rise off the ground and then land, only
to propell himself off of Pyro's cannon. Tavatron was completely 
oblivioius to the situation. She could never stand to see ground of 
any sort rush out from under her, and was too intent on keeping her 
grip on Dinobot to pay any real attention. 

Tavatron's spark was racing as Dinobot began to slow. She could feel 
Dinobot's muscles beneath her hands, each one seemed tensed in 
aticipation. She would probably have been enjoying the situation if 
Dinobot had not jumped like that, and with no warning! 

Dinobot's voice brought her back to the present situation. She slowly 
raised her head, her fur ruffled with sticks and twigs of various 
sorts protruding from her fur. She looked down at him, her optics
wide in shock. Her breathing was hard and somewhat difficult due to 
her injuries, but other than that she was fine:

"Comfortable? You want to know if I'm comfortable?"

Tavatron's voice was somewhat higher than usually, quite unlike her 
normal tone. She took a deep breath. Her body relaxed and her tone 
returned to normal as she calmed down:

"I'm fine."

His tone was somewhat sarcastic and teasing, it helped calm her down 
and take the edge off of the situation. It was then that Tavatron 
realized just how tightly she was holding on to him. She quickly 
loosened her grip to the point where she was no longer digging her 
heels into his sides, and so that her hands weren't hanging on to his 
neck for dear life. Now that she was relaxed she was beginning to 
enjoy the ride again. The scenery was quite refreshing, and the 
company wasn't that bad either. Tavatron smiled to herself. Well, if 
she had to be stuck in the forest and hunted by the Alliance she'd 
rather be with a 'bot she trusted. She trusted Dinobot, he had saved 
her life on multiple occasions. Being around him made her feel... 
safer. Tavatron folded her arms and rested them atop Dinobot's head.
A smile was on her face, and her tone was somewhat lighthearted:

"I think you're enjoying this a little too much."
